intro: Centromadia pungens var. parryi, commonly known as the Parry's centromadia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. This variant is distinguished by its slightly smaller size and more compact growth habit compared to the typical form of Centromadia pungens.
